Class SocketServerHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Network.Socket.Client.SocketServerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualServer, Remote
public class SocketServerHandler extends Object implements VirtualServer
SocketServerHandler is a class responsible for handling socket-based server communication in a multiplayer game environment. It serves as an implementation of the VirtualServer interface, facilitating client-server interactions by managing player states, game actions, and client connections. This class handles various game-related operations such as setting player readiness, starting a game, picking and discarding components, manipulating tiles on the game board, flipping hourglasses, activating cards, and more. It also manages the connection state of players and the communication between the client and server via sockets.

    • connectToServerTUI

      public static SocketServerHandler connectToServerTUI(String[] args, ClientModel clientModel, Scanner scanner, EnhancedClientView enhancedClientView) throws InterruptedException, ClassNotFoundException
      Establishes a connection to the server using a Text-Based User Interface (TUI). This method handles user input for selecting a nickname and interacts with the server to join the lobby, ensuring the connection is properly initiated.
      Parameters:
      args - an array of strings containing the host address and port number as the first and second elements respectively
      clientModel - the client-side representation of the game model
      scanner - a Scanner object for reading user input
      enhancedClientView - the enhanced view object used for display purposes
      Returns:
      a SocketServerHandler object that facilitates communication with the server, or null if the connection fails
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found

    • connectToServerGUI

      public static SocketServerHandler connectToServerGUI(String host, int port, String name, ClientModel clientModel, GalaxyTruckerGUI view) throws InterruptedException
      Establishes a connection to the server using a Graphical User Interface (GUI) and performs the necessary interactions to join the lobby or handle connection issues. This method ensures proper communication setup between the client and server.
      Parameters:
      host - the server's hostname or IP address
      port - the port number on which the server is listening
      name - the player's chosen nickname
      clientModel - the client-side representation of the game model
      view - the GUI object used for display and user interaction
      Returns:
      a SocketServerHandler object that facilitates communication with the server, or null if the connection fails
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting
